question: Compounds P and R in the following reaction are
<katex>$$CH_{3}CHO \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{3}O^{+ }]{(i)CH_{3}MgBr} P \xrightarrow[heat]{conc H_{2}SO_{4}} Q \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{2}O_{2}/OH^{-}]{(i)B_{2}H_{6}} R$$</katex>
explanation: **Step 1:** Reaction of Acetaldehyde (<katex>$CH_3CHO$</katex>) with Grignard reagent followed by hydrolysis gives Propan-2-ol (P).
**Step 3:** Hydroboration-oxidation of Q gives Propan-1-ol (R). This reaction follows anti-Markovnikov addition.
**Conclusion:** P is Propan-2-ol and R is Propan-1-ol. They differ in the position of the -OH group, so they are **Position isomers**.
